Reclaimed products and thei packaging materials

column7: Wesfarmers consumed 19.34 petajoules of energy in 2023.

column6: Energy consumption outside of the organization

column13: During the year, Wesfarmers' Bunnings celebrated the installation of its hundredth on-site solar PV system at its Palmerston Warehouse in the Northern Territory. Since 2014, Bunnings has progressively installed on-site solar PV systems across its Australian network to support the decarbonisation of its operations by generating renewable electricity on-site.

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column13: Opportunities exist to improve the energy efficiency of Wesfarmers' divisions' stores and facilities. For example, the divisions retrofit and optimise operating conditions by introducing building management systems, LED lighting, and efficient heating and cooling systems.

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
Interactions with water as a shared resource
column13: WesCEF reviewed water source options for daily operations and future growth projects in the 2023 financial year, and two potentially viable solutions were identified. First, WesCEF increased its water allocation from the Kwinana Water Reclamation Plant (KWRP). Second, builtit built an additional reverse osmosis plant on-site that removes contaminants from wastewater to be reused for operational purposes.
column20: Water source, growth project, water allocation

column13: WesCEF reused its nutrient-rich wastewater at its CSBP Kwinana site in Western Australia, which an external compost-producing facility utilises. Progress was also made to repurpose wastewater at the CSBP Geraldton site in Western Australia, which involves incorporating the wastewater into a new low-strength liquid fertiliser being trialled with a regional grower. In addition, bulk containers normally used for chemical storage continue to be returned to the supplier for reuse or recycling.

column7: Wesfarmers consumed 5,990 megalitres of water in 2023.

column6: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: In partnership with Restoring Australia, Wesfarmers' Officeworks continued planting across the Western Australian Wheatbelt region during the year, taking the total number of trees planted in Western Australia to more than 450,000, restoring more than 300 hectares of habitat. These plantings have improved the habitat for several endangered species, including three types of endangered black cockatoo.
column14: The number of trees planted in Western Australia to more than 450,000, restoring more than 300 hectares of habitat.

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: Officeworks planted nearly 20,000 trees in Victoria across the Central Otways and Victorian Volcanic Plains. The total number of trees planted in Victoria is approaching 400,000, restoring more than 300 hectares of habitat for many endangered animals, such as the Greater Glider, South-eastern Red-tailed Black Cockatoo and Corangamite Water Skink. In the Tasmanian Midlands, nearly 30,000 trees were planted, with the total number of trees planted across Tasmania surpassing 200,000 across more than 450 hectares.
column14: In the Tasmanian Midlands, nearly 30,000 trees were planted, with the total number of trees planted across Tasmania surpassing 200,000 across more than 450 hectares.

column6: IUCN Red List species and national conversation list species with habitats in areas affected by operations

column7: Wesfarmers scope 1 emissions in 2023 were 845,870 tCO2e.
Wesfarmers scope 2 emissions in 2023 were 350,814 tCO2e.
Wesfarmers scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 501,397 tCO2e.

column13: Wesfarmers' Kmart Group is a member of the Sustainable Apparel Coalition (SAC), a global, multi-stakeholder non-profit alliance for the fashion industry focused on sustainable production. In 2011, SAC launched the Higg Index, an assessment tool to standardise the measurement of value chain sustainability, including the measurement of Scope 3 emissions.
column20: Higg Index, Sustainable Apparel Coalition, fashion industry

column13: Wesfarmers adopts sustainable design principles for new stores and facilities to materially improve energy efficiency, reduce emissions and deliver cost savings. For example, Bunnings' new store format can deliver emissions efficiencies of around 30 per cent.
column20: Sustainable design principle, energy efficiency, emissions

column13: Wesfarmers invests in behind-the-meter electricity from renewable and waste-heat sources to power its operations. Generally, this is on-site solar, although WesCEF generates electricity through waste heat recovery.
